title: Nigerians in seven big clashes across five leagues
body_text:
Nigerian players will be in the spotlight across top leagues on Sunday (today), with seven crucial fixtures featuring stars who could play pivotal roles in matches that could shape title races, European qualification battles, and relegation fights, PETER AKINBO writes
NIGERIA
Rivers United vs Remo Stars
The Nigeria Premier Football League’s title race could be decided when second-placed Rivers United host league leaders Remo Stars in Port Harcourt.
With just seven matches remaining after this weekend’s fixtures, Remo Stars hold a commanding eight-point advantage and a game in hand over their closest challengers. Rivers United captain Temple Emekayi has urged his teammates to bounce back from recent disappointments.
“I know it will take a little bit to get going again, but I think what we are playing for in the league is enough motivation for all of us,” he told PUNCH Sports Extra.
Rivers United are seeking to recover from consecutive defeats—a 1-0 loss to Bayelsa United in the league and a shock 2-1 exit to Beyond Limits FA in the President Federation Cup.
“Every game now is so important, it has been for a while. It has been so tight and so competitive,” Emekayi added. “We want to win something, and that’s been the big goal. But I think we can’t look too far ahead; we have to take it day by day, and game by game.”
A win for Rivers would cut Remo Stars’ lead to five points, breathing new life into the title race. Defeat, however, would all but confirm the Ikenne-based side as champions.
ENGLAND
Fulham vs Liverpool (Iwobi, Bassey)
Alex Iwobi will have more than Fulham pride at stake when Liverpool visit Craven Cottage on Sunday. The Nigerian midfielder, alongside fellow Super Eagles star Calvin Bassey, will be key to Fulham’s plans against the champions-elect.
The former Arsenal player could do his academy club a favour in the title race with the Gunners 12 points behind the Reds.
Liverpool top the Premier League table with 73 points from 30 games, and victory would keep Arne Slot’s men on course for their first league title since 2020.
Iwobi has been Fulham’s most influential midfielder this season, contributing seven goals and three assists in 30 league appearances. He was rested for the first hour of Fulham’s narrow loss to Arsenal during the week but still made a notable impact after coming on.
His importance is reflected not just in goals but in buildup play, leading all players in Europe’s top five leagues in progressive carries into the final third (86). With Fulham scoring 28% of their league goals through Iwobi’s direct involvement, he remains Marco Silva’s most reliable attacking outlet.
Calvin Bassey, meanwhile, was an unused substitute against Arsenal, likely rested for this crucial fixture. The 25-year-old centre-back has made 29 appearances across all competitions and scored twice this season.
Tottenham vs Southampton (Aribo, Onuachu)
Joe Aribo and Paul Onuachu could feature in a match that might confirm Southampton’s Premier League relegation at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.
Onuachu has scored four goals and provided one assist in 20 appearances and is in line for a bench role.
Aribo, with three goals in 29 matches, is expected to be promoted to the starting lineup as the Saints fight to avoid becoming the first team in Premier League history to be relegated as early as matchday 31.
Southampton currently sit bottom of the table with just 10 points, and will be relegated if they lose to Tottenham and Wolves beat Ipswich Town on Saturday.
For Spurs, the match represents a chance to rebuild momentum after a disappointing 1-0 defeat to Chelsea, with Ange Postecoglou expected to rotate his squad ahead of Thursday’s Europa League quarter-final against Eintracht Frankfurt.
SPAIN
Sevilla vs Atletico Madrid (Ejuke, Adams)
Nigerian forwards Chidera Ejuke and Akor Adams will hope to make an impact when Sevilla host Atletico Madrid at the Estadio Ramon.
Both players featured in Sevilla’s 2-1 defeat to Real Betis last weekend, with Adams making only his second appearance for the club since returning from injury. The striker is still searching for his first goal for Sevilla.
Ejuke has contributed two goals and one assist in 19 appearances this season and remains an important attacking option for Garcia Pimienta’s side, who sit 11th in La Liga.
Atletico Madrid, meanwhile, are looking to end a winless run that extends back to early March. Diego Simeone’s side have seen their title hopes fade in recent weeks, currently sitting third in the table, nine points off leaders Barcelona.
Sevilla will be looking to avoid a third straight defeat after losses to Athletic Bilbao and Real Betis, while Atletico need a victory to maintain their grip on a Champions League qualification spot.
ITALY
Atalanta vs Lazio (Lookman vs Dele-Bashiru)
Two Nigeria internationals will face off in Bergamo on Sunday evening as Ademola Lookman’s Atalanta host Fisayo Dele-Bashiru’s Lazio in a crucial Serie A clash.
Both teams are faltering in their quest for Champions League football, with neither having won in their last two matches. Atalanta have lost their last two games without scoring, while Lazio have managed just one win from their last six Serie A fixtures.
When these sides last met in December, both Nigerians made significant contributions, with Dele-Bashiru scoring a brilliant goal and Lookman providing the assist for Atalanta’s equaliser in a 1-1 draw.
Lazio manager Marco Baroni recently urged Dele-Bashiru to improve his performance in the final third.
Lookman, meanwhile, will be looking to break his recent goal drought. Despite being one of Serie A’s most dangerous attackers earlier in the season, the Nigerian forward has struggled for form in 2025.
PORTUGAL
Porto vs Benfica (Zaidu Sanusi)
Super Eagles defender Zaidu Sanusi could feature in Portugal’s biggest derby when Porto welcome title-chasing Benfica to the Estadio do Dragao on Sunday.
The left-back has struggled for game time this season, making just three league appearances as he continues his recovery from a long-term anterior cruciate ligament injury.
Porto sit third in the Primeira Liga, nine points behind second-placed Benfica, who are locked in a title race with Sporting Lisbon. Victory for the Dragons would not only tighten their grip on a Champions League qualification spot but also revive their fading title hopes.
The last meeting between these Portuguese giants ended in a humbling 4-1 defeat for Porto, but they will take heart from their most recent clash at the Estadio do Dragao, where they produced an emphatic 5-0 victory.
TURKEY
Fenerbahce vs Trabzonspor (Bright Osayi-Samuel)
Bright Osayi-Samuel could get a start as Fenerbahce hosts Trabzonspor in one of Turkish football’s most intense rivalries.
The Nigerian defender, whose contract expires at the end of the season, has been linked with a return to England, with Crystal Palace and Nottingham Forest reportedly interested in his services.
Jose Mourinho’s side currently sit six points behind league leaders Galatasaray with a game in hand and will be desperate for victory to keep their title hopes alive.
Osayi-Samuel has been a key figure for Fenerbahce this season, following a turbulent end to the previous campaign when he was controversially involved in a post-match incident during their second clash against Trabzonspor in March 2024.
Tension started flaring in the 87th minute when objects were thrown onto the field after Michy Batshuayi scored what proved to be the winner for Fenerbahce. A melee ensued after the game that had the defender engage a pitch invader in a boxing contest. The Turkish FA eventually cleared him of any wrongdoing.
Trabzonspor will be looking to build on their recent good form under new manager Fatih Tekke, who has overseen a victory and a draw in his first two league matches in charge.
